instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video???
threads.message:
This was a donated macbook. Installed a SSD, loaded OSX and while charging the battery up the screen just randomly went out. Tried a good known test screen as well but still no image or backlight. Chimes and has USB activity.  0V on <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL>

Board has no liquid damage. What to check next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video???
threads.message:
Check for corrosion near LCD connector.

Do you get 3V at pins 18/19, at least in the first seconds (when chime)?
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> should go to 2.65V at same time; if LCD connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video???
threads.message:
Yes no corrosion near LCD connector,

0v at pins 18/19 even at first few seconds when chime

<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> remains at 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video???
threads.message:
"0v at pins 18/19"
Check diode mode to ground, w/ LCD connected.

Test for voltage there w/o LCD connected.
At least few seconds must appear.
Keep voltmeter connected, pulg in the charger and monitor voltage 10s in that point.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video???
threads.message:
0.460 diode mode w/ LCD

Voltage remains at 0 with meter connected from time charger is plugged in. Also measured at L8304

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video???
threads.message: Check if <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> tries to come on at least.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video???
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL>  also 0V

 <RESISTOR>R1431</RESISTOR> 67K

Could this be bad CPU even though it chimes with usb activity???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video???
threads.message:
Looks like...

PCH should enable 3V for LCD first.
If LCD replies with correct <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL>, voltage is maintained and eDP output enabled too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video???
threads.message: Anything else I could check at this point or is this hopeless?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video???
threads.message: Heat PCH area with quality flux.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video???
threads.message:
found a small spec of corrosion on pad 2 of <CAPACITOR>C8160</CAPACITOR>. Scrapped it away and now board does not come on at all. No green light. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> only 8.20V

Should SMC be replaced even though no liquid damage in that area???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video???
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video???
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video???
threads.message: Bad IO cable was causing it not to turn on. Still 0v on <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL>. Will heat PCH with quality flux and try ultrasonic. Afterwards is there anything else to check or hopeless?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video???
